abstract: Taiwan’s broadcasting regulator said on Wednesday it sees a “strong chance” of approving private equity firm Carlyle Group’s 36 billion Taiwan dollars ($1.14 billion) sale of its Taiwan cable TV unit, Reuters reports.
snippet: Taiwan’s broadcasting regulator said on Wednesday it sees a “strong chance” of approving private equity firm Carlyle Group’s 36 billion Taiwan dollars ($1.14 billion) sale of its Taiwan cable TV unit, Reuters reports.
lead_paragraph: Taiwan’s broadcasting regulator said Wednesday that it sees a “strong chance” of approving the private equity firm Carlyle Group’s 36 billion Taiwan dollars ($1.14 billion) sale of its Taiwan cable TV unit, Reuters reports.

headline.main: Carlyle Set to Get Approval for $1.14 Billion Taiwan Sale
